title: Document required API keys for summarization feature
description:
## Required (pick your AI provider)
- OPENAI_API_KEY - For generating summaries (if using OpenAI)
- ANTHROPIC_API_KEY - For generating summaries (if using Anthropic)

## For Twitter/X (pick one method)
- SWEETISTICS_API_KEY - Easiest option, third-party API for Twitter access
- OR: TWITTER_AUTH_TOKEN + TWITTER_CT0 - Your Twitter session cookies (from browser dev tools)

## For Reddit
- REDDIT_CLIENT_ID - From reddit.com/prefs/apps
- REDDIT_CLIENT_SECRET - From reddit.com/prefs/apps
- REDDIT_USERNAME - Your Reddit account
- REDDIT_PASSWORD - Your Reddit password

## What works without keys?
- Articles: Just AI provider key (OpenAI or Anthropic)
- Twitter/X: AI key + Twitter auth
- Reddit: AI key + Reddit credentials

Minimum to get started: Just your existing OPENAI_API_KEY or ANTHROPIC_API_KEY — article summarization will work. Add Twitter/Reddit keys when you need those features.
close_reason: Documented required API keys in docs/reference/API.md.

title: Add file + media summarization pipeline
description:
Plan:
1) Input classification + routing: detect file vs URL vs raw text; preserve URL normalization; reject unsupported schemes.
2) Asset ingestion: accept uploaded files and remote assets; enforce size limits; detect media type; store bytes safely.
3) Attachment support: map images/PDFs to model-native attachments; inline text-like files.
4) Preprocessing pipeline: for non-text docs, convert to Markdown/text (markitdown/uvx-style) with timeouts and size caps; include provenance in metadata.
5) Media handling: support audio/video via transcript pipeline (yt-dlp/whisper/OpenAI/FAL) and/or direct multimodal models for video; expose timestamps option.
6) Prompting: use file-specific prompts (filename/mediaType/contentLength), length controls, language controls; include transcript timestamps when available.
7) Caching + metadata: cache extracted content/transcripts by content hash; store transcript source + duration; handle cache-bypass.
8) Security + validation: virus/malware scan hook, archive rejection, MIME sniffing, HTML/JS sanitization, PII redaction policy.
9) API surface: add endpoint(s) that accept files/urls; return extracted content + summary + diagnostics.
10) Tests: unit tests for classification, media type detection, preprocessing, and transcript timestamp handling.

title: Auto-summarize URLs on capture
description:
Integrate /summarize functionality into /capture endpoint so URLs are automatically summarized when captured.

## Goals
- When a URL is captured, automatically extract and summarize the content
- Use bird CLI for Twitter/X URLs (when configured)
- Use snoowrap for Reddit URLs (when configured)
- Use Cheerio for article URLs (always available)
- Store summary alongside enriched content

## Approach
- Create new feature branch from main
- Add 'summary' field to content_items or reuse description
- Call SummarizeService from ContentService.capture()
- Make summarization async (fire-and-forget) like enrichment
- Handle graceful degradation when services not configured

## Acceptance Criteria
- POST /capture with a URL auto-generates summary
- Summary stored in content_items
- Works for Twitter, Reddit, and article URLs
- Graceful fallback when Twitter/Reddit not configured
close_reason: Auto-summarize capture feature implemented (summary column, async summarization + fallback, tests, docs).
